{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Carey Coombs murmur is a mid-diastolic murmur, not a delayed diastolic murmur. It is indeed seen in cases of rheumatic fever, specifically during the acute phase. It can be associated with Acute Rheumatic (AR) carditis, which is a complication of rheumatic fever. Lastly, it is characterized as a low-pitched murmur.", "answer_choice": "A" }
